children.subject: That's correct. If you do not fall into the 3 categories I listed, you will be sent to the waitlist. Once I know more information, I will manually enroll those students from the waitlist into the class. As soon as I know who this "other" category is, I will make another announcement.

Alright, thanks! I guess when I try adding myself to the waitlist I'll see what position I'm at and then decide whether I want to try staying on it or not. 

I thought that 16A was supposed to be a freshman-oriented class though?

That is the intention of the faculty, however we do need to prioritize seniors in their last semester so they are able to graduate. The size of the class is limited due to lab space. Once we get into a more steady state, we should be able to change the priorities.
Alright, I see. thanks again!

Is it possible that for next Fall, EE16A will begin to prioritize freshmen? I would be a sophomore by then and if the department suddenly started prioritizing freshmen it would suck for me, since even though I'm a freshman right now I probably won't be able to get into the class.

Hi There,

At this point we're not sure how future semester priorities will be done. This spring, there are seats being set aside for EECS students as a whole; it is not being done by year.

If you are very concerned about this spring (and next year), you can use your Phase I units for 16A.

I'm a freshman, undeclared in L&S. When I was carefully planning my schedule, I thought that I could get into 16A through open seating, as I have a relatively early telebears date, Oct 26. Will there be no open seating at all now?

Q: Should Phase I 16A if I don't fall into one of the above 3 categories e.g. LSCS sophomore/junior or LS Undeclared?

 A: Again, it's hard for us to say right now. If we are able to accommodate non-senior LSCS students and LS Undeclared and you are higher on the waitlist, then you will have a better chance of getting into the class. It's always best practice to monitor the enrollment and then if needed, change your classes during Open Hours.
Er, I think this person meant s/he is an LSCS senior.

There are seats set aside for you, however if you are a graduating senior you may still want to Phase I this class, especially since LSCS seniors will first be sent to the waitlist and then manually enrolled based on their non-AP level (see updated announcement). We estimate that ~200 LSCS seniors will need 16A this spring and have reserved those seats, however you still may want to Phase I 16A.
If I do fall into one of the above categories (specifically and LSCS senior), do I have to phase 1 EE16A?

I'm not sure what your major is, so this is a hard question to answer. If you're LSCS, I would suggest making an appointment to see Lily Zhang or Christopher Hunn in 379 and 377 Soda Hall, respectively. If you're EECS, you can come to 205 Cory Hall, or see your ESS advisor in 230 Bechtel if you are an EECS or non-EECS COE major.

Regardless, it sounds like you will need to Phase I EE16A.

I'm currently a junior, but I would really like to study abroad during Fall 2016. If I don't take EE16A next semester, I will only get to take it during Spring 2017 and I won't be able to take any EE upperdivs with a 16A pre-req. Is there anything I can do about this?

Hi,

Please see the email announcement that was just sent to EECS undergraduates. There are seats being set aside for EECS students (and the students listed in my first post), so you are able to use Phase II units for 16A.
What is the title of this email? I can't seem to find it.
How about for ME major thinking about EECS minor. Can I also phase II it?

The EECS email was posted on here as well. Please see @543.

Austin, COE was going to contact the ENG students as well, which I think they may have already done. About 200 seats are being reserved for COE students as well so you may Phase II this class. However, if this class is a high priority for you, you should use Phase I. Monitor the enrollment and change during Open Hours, if needed.
Just making sure, as an EECS major (2nd year), I don't have to phase1 right?
Please see post @501.

I'm an LSCS Junior (with Senior Standing) so it seems like I will not be able to enroll directly in the course but I really want to take EE upper division courses so I need to take 16A as soon as possible. Should I use Phase 1 units and get on the waitlist? Or can I wait till Phase 2?

Hi Amanda,

Have you met with Lily or Christopher to discuss graduating early? In any case, we would advise that you Phase I this class if you intend to graduate early.

Hi, I'm an LS CS junior with senior standing. However I plan on graduating early because of financial circumstances. If I cannot take EE16A this coming semester, I will likely need to take a semester or two off to be able to afford finishing school. Is there a way I can distinguish myself as a pseudo-senior (who is about to graduate) rather than a junior, so I can take EE16A?

history.content:
Seats will be set aside for the following students:

  • EECS majors
  • LSCS seniors
  • COE all majors

The rest of the seats will be reserved, which means all students who do not fall into one of the above categories will be sent to the waitlist. Unfortunately, at this point we don't know who the rest of the seats will go to, but we hope to know this information very soon.

Q: Should Phase I 16A if I don't fall into one of the above 3 categories e.g. LSCS sophomore/junior or LS Undeclared?

A: Again, it's hard for us to say right now. If we are able to accommodate non-senior LSCS students and LS Undeclared and you are higher on the waitlist, then you will have a better chance of getting into the class. It's always best practice to monitor the enrollment and then if needed, change your classes during Open Hours.

We hope to have more information for you soon!

**One correction**: Though LSCS seniors have seats reserved for them, they will still be sent to the waitlist so that we can distinguish between true seniors (by their non-AP level) and those sophomores and juniors with lots of AP units. The reserved seats are for true LSCS seniors only.
history.subject: Enrollment Procedure for 16A, Spring '16
